channel.title: [project]PHPfornoobs
channel.description:
[project]PHPfornoobs Hey guys, I am currently working on a project that helps noobs learn PHP/MYSQL/HTML/JAVASCRIPT. It will show them how PHP files work (from what I have found out.....)by asking them questions like: "read through this file and tell me what line 7 does:", after they are told how certian parts of a script work... In a few sentences: It would teach you how to make a website the way I teach people how to make websites.... It will also give you information on how to set up your own webserver, open your ports, get a faster internet plan, how to upload files to a server through ftp or php. It wont be in a boring style like java books(I have only read about 2 lines of a java book because they are so boring... But I still figured out java by just reading the java files....)... Yeah, I'm really tired right now, so I might post some pics, and some information that makes more sense tomorrow...
When it is released it will come with a mini php/mysql server so you will actually be able to use it....

item.title: [project]PHPfornoobs
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Exception, post:5, topic:150478”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=206045.msg1814447#msg1814447 date=1192010234]
It would stop at die(), tbh.
[/quote]
By encapsulating each statement in separate <?php and ?> tags, I was hoping to imply they were each executed separately.[/quote]But if they’re in the same source, they wouldn’t xP

Read full topic

item.title: [project]PHPfornoobs
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

<?php
unset($_COOKIE['itsowncookies']);
?>
<?php
die('goatee');
?>
<?php
echo('<img src="apicture.png" />');
?>

I’m thinking they are all possible

Read full topic

item.title: [project]PHPfornoobs
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Okay but i hope it asks multiple choice questions, like what does line 3 do?:

  1. Kill people
  2. Eat their cookies
  3. Show a picture
  4. Eat it’s own cookies.

Read full topic

It will show them how PHP files work (from what I have found out…)by asking them questions like: “read through this file and tell me what line 7 does:”, after they are told how certian parts of a script work… In a few sentences: It would teach you how to make a website the way I teach people how to make websites… It will also give you information on how to set up your own webserver, open your ports, get a faster internet plan, how to upload files to a server through ftp or php.
